between women given vitamin A compared with controls. 
After an analysis of currently available evidence, WHO published a guideline indicating that 
vitamin A supplementation is not recommended during pregnancy as part of routine antenatal 
care for the prevention of maternal and infant morbidity and mortality. The use of a supplement
